title: 2-year-old in critical condition after holiday shooting
content:
DETROIT-- A 2-year-old suffered a gunshot wound to the body after an argument ensued during a holiday gathering at 1:05 a.m. Tuesday morning on Detroit's east side, police said.
The incident occurred in the parking lot near the Chandler Park branch of the Detroit Public Library, on the 12800 block of Harper, according to police.
According to Detroit police officer Shanelle Williams, an argument began after some men were asked to leave the gathering, but refused.
A man began shooting, and one of the bullets wounded the child. She was taken to an area hospital and is in critical condition.
Police say they have identified a suspect, but have not made an arrest at this time.
